P009173.project_name: Montenegro Agriculture and Agro Industry Project

keywords.cdata: Accounting,agricultural cooperatives,Agricultural Credit,agricultural development,agricultural production,agricultural products,Agriculture,audits,bad debts,balance sheets,Bank loans,banking structure,Banks,borrowing,capital markets,consumers,crops,debt,deposits,Development Strategy,Economic Justification,Economic Rate of Return,employment,equipment,excess demand,exports,extension,farm credit,farmers,farms,feed,fertilizers,financial crisis,financial management,financial reporting,Financial Structure,FISCAL YEAR,fish,fisheries,food processing,Forecasts,foreign exchange,Forestry,GNP,growth rate,imports,income,income statements,incomes,inflation,insurance,interest rate,Interest Rates,labor force,labor productivity,land development,liquidation,liquidity,livestock,low interest rates,m2,management information systems,Marketing,pastures,per capita income,portfolios,private sector,productivity,resource allocation,resource mobilization,Rural development,savings

project_abstract.cdata: The Montenegro Agriculture and Agro Industry Projects will include: Montenegro: (i) the establishment of a sprinkler irrigation system; (ii) land preparation for and planting of vineyards with wine and table grapes, peach and sour cherry plantations, and windbreaks; (iii) farm roads, equipment sheds and supporting facilities and experimental research on new fruit trees varieties; (iv) a winery including byproduct processing facilities; (v) a cold store with blast freezing, grading and packing facilities for fruits and vegetables; and (vi) a collecting center including storage space. Macedonia: (i) processing facilities including a dairy plant, slaughterhouse, potato cold store and fruit and vegetable processing facilities; (ii) investments in grape and fruit production, plastic greenhouses and mechanization for vegetable and livestock production, and tobacco drying facilities; and (iii) a feasibility study for a wholesale market center for agricultural products. The Macedonia Agriculture and Agroindustries Project will include: Montenegro: (i) the establishment of a sprinkler irrigation system; (ii) land preparation for and planting of vineyards with wine and table grapes, peach and sour cherry plantations, and windbreaks; (iii) farm roads, equipment sheds and supporting facilities and experimental research on new fruit trees varieties; (iv) a winery including byproduct processing facilities; (v) a cold store with blast freezing, grading and packing facilities for fruits and vegetables; and (vi) a collecting center including storage space.
